#Code by  Georgii Sirotenko  https://www.kaggle.com/georgiisirotenko/pytorch-fish-outliers-handling-test-100
    
import plotly.graph_objects as go    

fig = go.Figure(
    data=[ go.Bar(x=df['language'].value_counts().index, 
            y=df['language'].value_counts().values,
            text=df['language'].value_counts().values,
            textposition='auto',name='Count',
           marker_color='indianred')],
    layout_title_text="Language Distribution"
)
fig.show()
source.876b0b65:
from urllib.parse import * 
parse_url = urlparse('https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e1/Thermopylae_ancient_coastline_large.jpg')
print(parse_url)
print("\n")
unparse_url = urlunparse(parse_url)
print(unparse_url)
source.0db5aa29:
#Code by https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/how-to-open-an-image-from-the-url-in-pil/

import urllib.request

from PIL import Image

#urllib.request.urlretrieve(‘Image url’, “file_name”)

urllib.request.urlretrieve(
  'https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e1/Thermopylae_ancient_coastline_large.jpg',
   "Thermopylae_ancient_coastline_large.jpg")
  
img = Image.open("Thermopylae_ancient_coastline_large.jpg")
img.show()

source.8a1daf43:
#Code by https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40911170/python-how-to-read-an-image-from-a-url

import urllib.request

URL = 'https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e1/Thermopylae_ancient_coastline_large.jpg'

with urllib.request.urlopen(URL) as url:
    with open('temp.jpg', 'wb') as f:
        f.write(url.read())

img = PIL.Image.open('Thermopylae_ancient_coastline_large.jpg')

img.show()
source.b7c30b93:
#Code by  https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7391945/how-do-i-read-image-data-from-a-url-in-python

from PIL import Image
import urllib.request
import io

URL = 'https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e1/Thermopylae_ancient_coastline_large.jpg'

with urllib.request.urlopen(URL) as url:
    f = io.BytesIO(url.read())

img = Image.open('Thermopylae_ancient_coastline_large.jpg')

img.show()
